creator: robert.ryals@trifolium.com
text:
JMSAppender publishes topic messages as non-persistent, it would be nice to add 
set/getDeliveryMode() so this can be configured to send persistent messages.

creator: wolle@micromata.de
text:
I wrote a PersistentJMSAppender, which can be configured, that it even stores
the LoggingEvent in a local file, when JMS is down. 
PersistentJMSAppender has the following options:
  - TopicBindingName
  - TopicConnectionFactory
  - Provider (rmi://host:port/JndiServer), to connect to a remote registry
  - InitialContext
  - PersistanceFile
  - ReconnectTimeOut
I'll send the file in the next days to Ceki.
